system.appearance: Complete sets of bones, usually humanoid, sometimes with magely garb or items.

overview.base: You must @L[Drain:Mana]{mana drain} at least 3 creatures to @L[Condition:Dead]{death} every day or you start taking penalties. If 24 hours pass and you have not fed, you lose your your largest @L[Core:HP]{hit die} and @L[Core:MP]{mana die}. Your @L[Core:HP]{HP} and @L[Core:MP]{MP} maximums decrease by the value of those dice. For each additional 24 hours you go without feeding, you lose your next largest @L[Core:HP]{hit die} and @L[Core:MP]{mana die}. To restore lost @L[Core:HP]{hit dice} and @L[Core:MP]{mana dice}, you must feed more than normal. If you feed on at least 6 creatures within a 24 hour period, you restore 1 lost @L[Core:HP]{hit die} and @L[Core:MP]{mana die}.

You count as being @L[Keyword:Undead]{undead} for the purposes of @L[Category:Abilities]{abilities}, @L[Category:Damage types]{damage}, and other @L[Category:Effects]{effects}. You also gain @L[Ability:Ethereal Senses]{Ethereal Senses}, @L[Ability:Healing Sensitivity]{Healing Sensitivity}, @L[Ability:Magical Durability]{Magical Durability}, @L[Ability:Mana Drain Touch]{Mana Drain Touch}, @L[Ability:Undead Mind]{Undead Mind}, and @L[Ability:Undying Durability]{Undying Durability}.
You can see and hear spirits and @L[Condition:Ethereal]{Ethereal} creatures.

@L[Core:Healing]{Healing} can be used to @L[Core:Damage]{damage} you. If the creature providing you @L[Core:Healing]{healing} specifies that they are doing so "for damage" then you roll your largest @L[Core:HP]{hit die} and take that much @L[Damage:Holy]{holy damage} instead of the normal @L[Core:Healing]{healing} effect. This does not consume any of your @L[Core:HP]{hit dice}.

results.hit: Deal [[/drain 1d8[mana]]] @L[Category:Drain types]{drain} to the target. If this @L[Condition:Dead]{kills} the target, you @L[Core:Revitalizing]{revitalize}.
results.critHit: Deal [[/drain 2d8[mana]]] @L[Category:Drain types]{drain} to the target. If this @L[Condition:Dead]{kills} the target, you @L[Core:Revitalizing]{revitalize} twice.

overview.base: You are @L[Keyword:Immunity]{immune} to being @L[Condition:Frightened]{frightened} or @L[Condition:Charmed]{charmed}. The effects of Undead Mind are maintained even if @L[Condition:Transformed]{transformed}.

You are @L[Keyword:Immunity]{immune} to @L[Condition:Unconscious]{unconsciousness}, @L[Condition:Suffocating]{suffocating}, and being @L[Condition:Poisoned]{poisoned}. You do not @L[Condition:Down]{drop} due to being at negative @L[Core:HP]{HP}. You still @L[Condition:Dead]{die} when you reach half your maximum @L[Core:HP]{HP} below zero. You also do not have to @L[Core:Drowning]{breathe}.

@L[Category:Necromancy element abilities]{Necromancy} @L[Category:Magically powered abilities]{magic} you cast costs half as much @L[Core:MP]{MP} (rounded down) as it would otherwise. If any @L[Category:Control effects]{spell lets you control}, @L[Category:Reanimation effects]{create, or reanimate} @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead} and requires @L[Core:Presence Tier]{presence tier} to do so, you may @L[Category:Control effects]{control}, @L[Category:Reanimation effects]{create, or reanimate} twice as much @L[Category:Undead creatures]{undead} per @L[Core:Presence Tier]{tier} as you would otherwise be able to. These benefits apply to all other @L[Category:Control effects]{control} @L[Category:Spells]{spells} as well.
For every @L[Category:Classes]{rank} you gain by @L[Core:Leveling Up]{leveling up}, you gain a @L[Class:Necromancer]{rank in Necromancer} as well.
You are @L[Keyword:Immunity]{immune} to @L[Category:Bows]{arrows} and @L[Category:Vitals target abilities]{vitals target abilities}.
